item.title: Fallout: New Vegas - Where to Find CZ57 Avenger Minigun
item.description:
Quick Links

  • CZ57 Avenger Location
  • The Devil's Throat
  • Finding the Avenger

Fallout: New Vegas has a large open world filled with hidden treasures and secrets. You never know what you might find in an unmarked cave or a smoldering crater. The Mojave Wasteland has kept New Vegas one of the most well-regarded games in the entire franchise.

The CZ57 Avenger is a unique variant of the minigun. It has a smaller magazine, deals more damage, and fires faster than the standard minigun. This gives it the highest damage per second count of any weapon in the entirety of Fallout: New Vegas. This guide will show you where this rare and powerful weapon is hidden in the Mojave Wasteland.

CZ57 Avenger Location

The CZ57 Avenger is located far to the east of New Vegas in The Devil's Throat . Follow the road from the New Vegas Medical Clinic east to find it. It's just past Bitter Springs and Ranger Station Bravo. The nearby Gypsum Trainyard will have a group of wandering Deathclaws and the hills above the road regularly spawn Cazadors. This area can be especially brutal for low-level characters. Even Young and Blind Deathclaws can quickly end the Courier in a few swings. Come prepared for a fight.

The Devil's Throat

The Devil's Throat is not much better. It's a massive crater filled with a pile of radioactive waste. Stepping close to the smoking center will net you up to 8 RADS per second. Bring some Rad-X, a Radiation Suit, or work quickly to not end up with severe radiation poisoning.

The crater will have a group of disgusting centaur enemies. There will also be a few tougher versions called Evolved Centaurs. It's best to keep your distance and strike from long range. Post up at the rim of the crater with a sniper rifle or other long-range weaponry. A silenced sniper rifle like the Ratslayer can quickly defeat the centaurs with the help of a few sneak critical hits.

Finding the Avenger

Once all the centaurs are down, walk down into the crater. There is an old damaged truck near the center. A dead super mutant will be lying face down behind it.

Enter it and walk towards the front to find a Dead Prospector. The CZ57 Avenger will be next to him. There will also be 5mm ammo strewn around the truck for it. If the Avenger is missing, check your companions' inventory as they may pick it up during the fight.

The prospector has a Party Hat and valuable Reinforced Combat Armor that you can loot off of him. The CZ57 Avenger can be repaired using standard miniguns.

item.title: Destiny 2: How To Activate Planetary Assimilation Pistons (Specimen ID: NES001 Guide)
item.description:
The Echoes episode for Destiny 2 sends players on a mission to find out what's going on with the Vex on Nessus, and to do so, they'll need to gather enough data with the help of Failsafe, an old friend from way back in the Red War campaign.

One of the early quests Failsafe gives Guardians called Specimen ID: NES001 involves finding and activating Planetary Assimilation Pistons. Unfortunately, the AI doesn't give players much of a clue about what they are. If you want to get on with the story or collect more of Destiny 2's Echoes weapons, here's how to complete this quest.

How To Find And Activate Planetary Assimilation Pistons in Destiny 2

After you complete the first steps of Destiny 2's Echoes episode, Failsafe will tell you to find and deposit some samples into the Radiolite Bay aboard the HELM. Then, she'll give you the Specimen ID: NES001 quest, which will ask you to collect data from the Breach Executable activity and trigger a Planetary Assimilation Piston somewhere in Nessus. The former is easy enough to do, but the latter has some players scratching their heads.

Planetary Assimilation Pistons are interactable objects that players can find while playing Breach Executable. They appear as pillars of Vex data rising from a metallic bronze base. Unfortunately, these appear at random during a Breach Executable run, and the game won't highlight their location until you're very close to them. To activate it, simply walk up to it and hold the interact button. This will require a charge from your Piston Hammer, the item Failsafe gives you before starting Specimen ID: NES001.

Piston Hammer charges refresh daily. However, you can get extra charges by completing Breach Executable or the Enigma Protocol Activity as you play Destiny 2 . Interacting with a Planetary Assimilation Piston will reveal nearby Radiolite samples. Collect and donate samples to Failsafe at the HELM or at the end of the mission to get even more loot.

Luckily, you don't need to smack a Planetary Assimilation Piston yourself to make progress with the quest. As long as one other member of the fireteam can interact with one, you'll get quest credit as well. This also applies to the Radiolite samples you get — all of them are shared between fireteam members, so there's no need to butt heads with each other over who gets to claim samples.

item.title: Rolling Hills: Make Sushi, Make Friends: Wi-Fi Woes Quest Walkthrough
item.description:
Rolling Hills: Make Sushi, Make Friends puts you in the shoes of rising chef Sushi Bot, who takes over the town's local sushi restaurant. It's your job to run the restaurant and help raise its popularity while helping its townsfolk as a game with community and friendship at heart. Consequently, there are several quests for Sushi Bot to complete, one being Wi-Fi Woes . This quest sees local NPC Coggie asking for Sushi Bot's help to fix the town's Wi-Fi, as he promises a super-fast internet connection to a prospective new resident, in a fun nod to modern technology woes. Of course, this is where you step in.

There are several steps in the Wi-Fi Woes quest, so you might wonder where to start first or what to do next. Fortunately, it's also one of the shorter quests in the restaurant management game that isn't too tricky to tick off once you know what to look for. Completing Rolling Hills' Wi-Fi Woes quest is also worthwhile as it unlocks Challenges, opening the door to grab more recipes and collectible hats for Sushi Bot.

How To Complete Wi-Fi Woes In Rolling Hills: Make Sushi, Make Friends

To begin the Wi-Fi Woes quest in Rolling Hills: Make Sushi, Make Friends , you must first increase your restaurant level to approximately level four or five . This triggers a scene where Coggie, one of Rolling Hills ' characters, asks you if you have a spare Wi-Fi antenna and explains why he needs one. He wants you to find an antenna to fix the town's Wi-Fi so a new resident can join.

Where To Find A Wi-Fi Antenna

To find a Wi-Fi antenna, you don't need to search the town for one. Instead, you need to speak with Maia in her café, who explains she can get one for you with enough money for the equipment. Visit Maia in her café and choose the Wi-Fi Woes dialogue option to ask her about the antenna, which could be next to the Going Green option if you've unlocked Rolling Hills ' Going Green quest. It turns out that if you can raise 500g , she can order the antenna for you.

Raise 500g For The Wi-Fi Antenna

It's now time to serve sushi to customers in the restaurant. Open the restaurant and serve customers until you've earned at least 500g to pay for the antenna.

Give Maia The Money

Once you've raised enough money, return to Maia in her café to give her the money. Quick as a flash, she whips up the antenna and gives it to you. However, you have to find somewhere suitable to place it.

Place The Wi-Fi Antenna At The Highest Point In Town

The next step in Rolling Hills ' Wi-Fi Woes quest is to place the W-Fi antenna at the highest point in town. Rolling Hills is a small town, so this narrows it down nicely as it's the only high place in the entire area. Of course, the Shrine is on the west side of the town and is the highest point available. Climb the stairs to the Shrine , and you'll see a small glimmer in front of it. Interact with the glimmer spot to place the Wi-Fi antenna, triggering a scene with Maia, who says it's the perfect place.

Test The Wi-Fi Signal Strength At The Farthest House From The Antenna

However, there is a small problem with the Wi-Fi signal, which needs testing to ensure it is strong enough to reach the farthest house in town. Travel east through town to the farthest house as pictured above and test the connection by interacting with another small glimmer spot in front of the house on the right. This completes the Wi-Fi test, which registers 99%.

Greet Min At The Bus Stop

The final step is to welcome the new resident to the charming town of Rolling Hills, a young girl called Min who turns out to be an Influencer, which explains the need for better internet capabilities. Sushi Bot, Coggie, and Maia welcome Min, completing Rolling Hills' Wi-Fi Woes quest. This also unlocks Challenges in Rolling Hills , which are activities that reward you with Influencer Points to spend in Min's shop. Here, you can buy new recipes and hats for Sushi Bot using Influencer Points, giving you even more collectibles to unlock.

Unlocking Challenges in Wi-Fi Woes also gives you more Rolling Hills: Make Sushi, Make Friends achievements to work towards obtaining, such as the Fashion Forward achievement for collecting all 10 hats in the game and the Cookbook Complete achievement for learning every recipe in Rolling Hills . It also enables you to invite Min for coffee or, later in the game, dessert in Maia's café to grow and upgrade her friendship level to give you more of her unique friendship bonuses and help towards completing the Getting to Know You achievement.

item.title: Hades 2: How To Unlock Oath Of The Unseen And Easiest Vows
item.description:
If you've been looking for a way to increase the difficulty in your Hades 2 runs or if you're hoping to get more Nightmares to upgrade your weapons, unlocking the Oath of the Unseen is exactly what you're looking for. The Oath of the Unseen provides players a way to add challenging modifiers like increased enemy health or disabling Arcana cards to each run. In exchange, if Melinoe defeats the designated boss with these challenges enabled, she'll be rewarded with a Nightmare.

Thankfully, unlocking the Oath is a straightforward and simple task, while the harder part is figuring out which vows to take since each one can break your entire build if you're not careful. If you've been struggling to figure out which vows make sense for you, or even how to unlock the Oath, then you've come to the right guide.

How To Unlock The Oath Of The Unseen

You Just Have To Beat One Boss

In order to unlock the Oath, you'll have to defeat Chronos once. While he can be a challenging fight, when you understand how Chronos' unique mechanics work, the final boss of the Underworld becomes a much easier battle to navigate.

After defeating the TItan of time, head to the practice area, and you'll get a message saying that you're now worthy of the Oath of the Unseen. You're now able to activate Testaments of Night by interacting with the pillar located between the entrances to the Underworld and the Surface . From there, you'll be able to choose which vows (run modifiers) you want to add to your next run.

How Do Testaments Of Night And Fear Level Work?

Getting Nightmares Will Be Worth The Trouble

On the left side of the Testament screen, you'll see five highlighted boss portraits - one for each of Melinoe's weapons. At the bottom of each portrait is a symbol representing one of those weapons and a number. These bosses are your designated targets and will drop a Nightmare for you when you defeat them with the indicated weapon and fear level.

To increase your fear level, you'll have to activate the vows on the right side of the screen. Each vow is worth a different amount of Fear, and activating them will add their value to the overall Fear of the run, which is indicated at the bottom of the screen.

Here's a list of all the vows currently in Hades 2 you can take and the amount of fear they add:

Vow Name

Effects

Ranks and Total Fear Added

Vow of Blood

All foes deal more damage.

  • Rank 1 : Foes deal 20% more damage. ( + 1 Fear)
  • Rank 2 : Foes deal 60% more damage. ( + 3 Fear)
  • Rank 3 : Foes deal 100% more damage. ( + 5 Fear)

Vow of Dominance

All foes have more health.

  • Rank 1 : All foes have 10% more health. (+1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: All foes have 20% more health. (+2 Fear)
  • Rank 3: All foes have 30% more health. (+3 Fear)

Vow Of Rebuke

All foes start with Barrier.

  • Each stack of Barrier negates one instance of damage

  • Rank 1 : All foes start with 1 Barrier. (+1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: All foes start with 2 Barrier. (+2 Fear)

Vow Of Fury

All foes move faster.

  • Rank 1: All foes are 20% faster. (+3 Fear)
  • Rank 2: All foes are 40% faster. (+ 6 fear)

Vow Of Suffering

In each encounter, you take bonus damage the first time you're struck.

  • Rank 1 : you take 100% bonus damage the first time you are stuck. (+2 Fear)
  • Rank 2 . you take 300% bonus damage the first time you are struck. (+4 Fear)

Vow of Commotion

Encounters have more foes.

  • Rank 1: 20% more foes. (+ 1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: 40% more foes. (+ 2 Fear)
  • Rank 3: 60% more foes. (+ 3 Fear)

Vow of Haunting

Slain foes have a chance to become a Revenant.

  • After 5 seconds, Revenants transform into the foe that spawned it. Collect it to destroy the Revenant.

  • Rank 1: Slain foes have a 25% chance to become a Revenant. (+1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: Slain foes have a 50% chance to become a Revenant. (+ 2 Fear)

Vow of Wandering

Foes have a chance to be an enemy from the next region (if there is one).

  • Rank 1: 10% chance foes are from the next region. (+ 1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: 25% chance foes are from the next region. (+ 3 Fear)

Vow of Scars

Healing effects are less effective.

  • Rank 1: Healing effects are 75% effective. (+ 1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: Healing effects are 50% effective. (+ 2 Fear)
  • Rank 3: Healing Effects are 0% effective. (+ 4 Fear)

Vow of Destitution

All items that cost gold are more expensive.

  • Rank 1: Items are 40% more expensive. (+ 1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: Items are 80% more expensive. (+ 2 Fear)

Vow of Panic

You enter each location with less Magick.

  • Rank 1: You enter each location with 0% Magick. (+ 1 Fear)

Vow of Forsaking

After you choose a boon, the unpicked blessings will not appear again this night.

  • Rank 1: After you choose a boon, the other 2 unpicked blessings will not appear this night. (+ 2 Fear)

Vow of Bitterness

The first boon(s) in each region become a red onion instead.

  • Red Onions restore 1 HP.

  • Rank 1: The first 1 Boon in each region is a Red Onion (+ 3 Fear)

Vow of Arrogance

Whenever you choose a boon, prime Magick for each rarity greater than common.

  • Rarity Levels are the following:
    • Common
    • Rare
    • Epic
    • Heroic

  • Rank 1: Prime 5 Magick for each rarity greater than Common. (+ 1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: Prime 10 Magick for each rarity greater than Common. (+ 4 Fear)

Vow of Desperation

You have a set amount of time to fight through each region or Melinoe will die. (time accumulates).

  • Rank 1: You have 9 minutes to fight through each region. (+ 1 Fear)
  • Rank 2: You have 7 minutes to fight through each region. (+ 3 Fear)
  • Rank 3: You have 5 minutes to fight through each region. (+ 6 Fear)

Vow of Abandon

Nullify the benefits of your Arcana Cards.

  • Rank 1: Nullify 100% of your Arcana cards. (+ 5 Fear)

Easiest Vows To Take For High Level Fear

It's Almost Free Fear If You're Careful

With all of that in mind, here are the easiest vows you can take relative to their Fear payoff.

Vow of Fury - Faster Enemies, Faster Rooms

  • Increased speed is a blessing and a curse.
  • It saves you time, but it makes Chronos a bit harder.

For most rooms, enemies will group up and approach you faster, allowing you to clear rooms quickly and efficiently. However, enemies and bosses will also attack faster. While it's not too troublesome against most enemies, this can be problematic against Chronos if you're still not comfortable with the fight. But once you get used to it, this is an easy 6 Fear to add to your runs.

Vow of Wandering - Meeting Enemies Sooner Isn't A Problem

  • If you know how to fight the enemies in Hades 2, this vow isn't too troublesome to deal with.
  • Oceanus can be a little more difficult thanks to the enemies from the Fields of Mourning.

Unfortunately for players, the Fields of Mourning carry numerous obnoxious foes which can make Oceanus a problematic biome to work through. However, since the maps in Oceanus are rather small and filled with choke points, it's much easier to close the gap and group these foes together to take them out quickly and painlessly than if you had fought them in the Fields.

To make this vow easier to handle, make sure you have most of your damage setup before the midpoint in Oceanus. After that, this vow will be a minor annoyance at worst for 3 Fear.

Vow of Panic - Easily Solved And Sometimes A Buff

  • Practically a free point of Fear for some builds
  • Arcana cards can be used to ignore or benefit off this vow

Starting rooms without magic isn't necessarily a bad thing. In fact, there are Arcana cards you can take to mitigate this effect or give you buffs from it. If you take the Huntress card and use a build that doesn't rely on Magick, this Vow practically gives you +50% damage in each room.

If you do need Magick, take the Unseen Arcana card to work around this vow without harming your build. Alternatively, if you can survive the first few rooms without Magick, you can find a god with a good Magick restoring boon like Hera to functionally ignore this Vow for a free Fear.

Vow of Desperation - Speeding Is Fun!

  • Most players don't take more than 5 minutes to complete a biome
  • Time is cumulative so you're rewarded for completing biomes quickly

This vow sounds scarier than it actually is.

In essence, Vow of Desperation gives you a limited time to complete each biome, but you're given more time at the beginning of each biome and the time you gain is cumulative. This means, at Rank 3, if you complete Erebus in 4 minutes (with 1 minute left on the clock), you'll have a total of 6 minutes to complete Oceanus. Additionally, this also means Vow of Desperation becomes less and less threatening as you get more of your build together because you'll be clearing rooms more efficiently and gaining more time in doing so.

Stores, rooms with Artemis or Icarus appearing, NPC rooms, material harvesting, and fountain rooms all stop the clock. If you need time to make a decision between two rooms, pause the game to also stop the clock and give yourself a moment to think.

Most players without any other vows will usually take somewhere between 3 and 4 minutes to finish each biome anyway, so if you don't waste too much time in each region and know how to get your build together, this can be an almost free 6 Fear.

item.title: Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance - Canon Of Creation Or Canon Of Vengeance
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Should You Take The Girl's Hand In Shin Megami Tensei 5 Vengeance
  • Which Canon Should You Play In SMTV Vengeance

Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance gives players a lot of new content to engage with, ranging from new demons to fight with, areas to explore, characters to meet, and a whole new story. Despite the new characters and story, the original story of Shin Megami Tensei 5 is not lost.

When starting a new game, players will be given the choice of the Canon of Creation or the Canon of Vengeance. This decision is incredibly important and can't be changed later on, and will determine which story plays out and what endings are possible to obtain.

Should You Take The Girl's Hand In Shin Megami Tensei 5 Vengeance

The storyline the game follows is determined in the opening cutscene and if the player takes the girl's hand or not ; leading to either the Canon of Creation or Canon of Vengeance. Canon of Creation will follow the original story for Shin Megami Tensei 5 and begins by refusing to take the girl's hand. The major story moments, areas visited, and possible endings will be exactly the same as the original, but the entire playthrough will have some small tweaks giving returning players new things to see and do. All of the gameplay changes that aren't tied to Vengeance's story will appear in Canon of Creation, but these changes are mostly quality-of-life updates and some new abilities to use.

If players decide to take the girl's hand, this will lead to the Canon of Vengeance . The Canon Of Vengeance will be full of new things for players to see. While the beginning of the game will play out mostly the same, this story will completely go in its own direction a few hours in. The Canon Of Vengeance will have new characters and a new central plot that leads to new possible endings and the Nahobino's new look. Players are given a second chance to change their minds before the game fully begins, and after that second confirmation, the choice is locked in.

Which Canon Should You Play In SMTV Vengeance

After the stories fully go in their own direction, there will be no crossover or needed information not given at the beginning of the game. Because of this, new players don't need to play the Canon of Creation first and can jump straight into the new storyline of Canon of Vengeance. The only major difference between the Canons will be the story and characters, with actual gameplay being similar across both paths.

Thanks to the game's multiple save slots, players can begin a playthrough on each Canon to try them both out to find their favorite or complete the other route in a subsequent playthrough. Both routes have multiple endings for players to see, giving them both reasons to be played and replayed.
